data.name: Range of Dates
data.description:
You are an employee of a section that tracks the number of orders
on a certain date and stores information in a hashtable whose key is the date. 

You were given the task to write a function that will return a `range of dates` in the format 
`"day.month.year"`
from the `first date` to the `end date`.
If the first date is later than the last, return an `empty array`.
Examples:
```python
# must include the start day and the end day !
date_range('01.12.2001','05.12.2001') # =>  ['01.12.2001', '02.12.2001', ... , '05.12.2001']
# if first day == last day should return  one day
date_range('01.12.2001','01.12.2001') # => ['01.12.2001']
# if first_day > last_day should return []
date_range('01.12.2001','01.12.2000') # => []
# the solution should work correctly with months !
date_range('01.12.2001','01.01.2002') # => ['01.12.2001', '02.12.2001', ... , '30.12.2001', '31.12.2001', '01.01.2002']
```
Good luck !
